title: "Girls Inc." geometric stencil face, similar to Futura Black
content:
I am the Youth Development Director for Girls Inc. I had t-shirts made for my dance team girls & have had several parents that I would like to give shirts too. I simply want to add "Mom", Grandma, Dad, etc. to them, but I can't seem to get the right font. Any help is greatly appreciated! Thanks so much...Gracie

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Girls Inc Logo.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071716/http:/typophile.com/files/Girls%20Inc%20Logo.JPG) | 6.07 KB |
author: GracieLoo92

comments.content:
It looks a little like [Futura Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071716/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=futura+black), but frankly I don't think I've seen this one before. Who designed the original logo?

On a side note, if you want to simply add something, you might go for contrast and use a dynamic, solid script face at the bottom of the logo. Just a suggestion.
Made me think of [Allegro](http://web.archive.org/web/20150310071716/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/bitstream/allegro_regular_ot/?sample_text=girls%20inc.&sample_size=96), but also no cigar.
